intro: Rhodosciadium glaucum var. lineare, commonly known as the linear-leaved glaucous rhodosciadium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and saline conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it a notable species in its native habitat.
